hiking.name: Mt. Whitney
hiking.description: Experience this 20.9-mile out-and-back trail near Lone Pine, California. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 13 h 0 min to complete. This is a very popular area for backpacking, camping, and hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are April through October. You'll need to leave pups at home — dogs aren't allowed on this trail.

hiking.name: Breakneck Ridge
hiking.description: Head out on this 3.2-mile loop trail near Cornwall-on-Hudson, New York. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 2 h 16 min to complete. This is a very popular area for hiking and rock climbing, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are April through November. Dogs are welcome, but must be on a leash.

hiking.name: Old Rag
hiking.description: Discover this 9.4-mile loop trail near Etlan, Virginia. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 5 h 25 min to complete. This is a very popular area for hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are May through October. You'll need to leave pups at home — dogs aren't allowed on this trail.

hiking.name: Bull Hill
hiking.description: Head out on this 5.4-mile loop trail near Cold Spring, New York. Generally considered a moderately challenging route, it takes an average of 3 h 1 min to complete. This is a very popular area for hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are April through October. Dogs are welcome, but must be on a leash.

hiking.name: Mt. Kilamanjaro
hiking.description: Enjoy this 40.8-mile point-to-point trail near Kibosho Magharibi, Kilimanjaro. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 30 h 16 min to complete. This is a very popular area for backpacking, camping, and hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. You'll need to leave pups at home — dogs aren't allowed on this trail.

hiking.name: Mt. Tammany
hiking.description: Explore this 3.6-mile loop trail near Pahaquarry, New Jersey. Generally considered a challenging route, it takes an average of 2 h 20 min to complete. This is a very popular area for hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. Dogs are welcome, but must be on a leash.

hiking.name: Billy Goat Trail
hiking.description: Discover this 3.9-mile loop trail near Potomac, Maryland. Generally considered a moderately challenging route, it takes an average of 1 h 18 min to complete. This is a very popular area for hiking, running, and walking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. You'll need to leave pups at home — dogs aren't allowed on this trail.

hiking.name: Humpback Rock
hiking.description: Check out this 3.8-mile loop trail near Nellysford, Virginia. Generally considered a moderately challenging route, it takes an average of 2 h 15 min to complete. This is a very popular area for birding, camping, and hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are April through September. Dogs are welcome, but must be on a leash.
